content: If one of the issues mentioned in the agenda got closed, it can just be removed right?

I've also done some of the procedure and fill out some of the Agenda's content.
Please tell me if I'm doing something wrong

I think that's the case :thumbs_up:
(tomorrow I'll start reviewing the agenda and clean up stuff that since last week moved forward)
@apiraino quick question: What does the "Old MCPs" section mean? MCPs that were "New" in the last meeting and are still not seconded?
yup correct. the github query gets MCPs (major change proposals) yet to be seconded
ah okay. thanks :+1:
basically those that are ready to be discussed (that's my understanding)

@Iñaki Garay thanks for adding to the meeting agenda the checkin for the rustc-dev-guide WG. Just a quick notice, I took the liberty of shorting it a little bit (hope it's ok). If you also have a brief summary and want to add it, feel free to do so
Absolutely! most of it is actually the output of a script the wg maintains for checkins, I went ahead since @Santiago Pastorino was on vacation until this week
thanks @Iñaki Garay and @apiraino for helping there

@Santiago Pastorino what we used to call libs-impl is now called T-libs-impl, see this: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/219381-t-libs/topic/Label.20for.20libs.20team.20on.20github
I'm going to update the agenda template and the triagebot code to reflect this change, so we are able to catch the issues on github
